DataElement.preferredName: Diagnosis HIV Hepatitis B Or C Infection Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow clinical study participation that are related to the investigation, analysis, recognition and presence of HIV, hepatitis B or hepatitis C as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnosis Human Immunodeficiency Virus Hepatitis B Infection Or Hepatitis C Infection Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Human immunodeficiency virus. Species of LENTIVIRUS, subgenus primate lentiviruses (LENTIVIRUSES, PRIMATE), formerly designated T-cell lymphotropic virus type III/lymphadenopathy-associated virus (HTLV-III/LAV). It is acknowledged to be the agent responsible for the acute infectious manifestations, neurologic disorders, and immunologic abnormalities linked to the ACQUIRED IMMUNODEFICIENCY SYNDROME._A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A viral infection caused by the hepatitis C virus._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Hepatitis B Infection Or Hepatitis C Infection Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Human immunodeficiency virus. Species of LENTIVIRUS, subgenus primate lentiviruses (LENTIVIRUSES, PRIMATE), formerly designated T-cell lymphotropic virus type III/lymphadenopathy-associated virus (HTLV-III/LAV). It is acknowledged to be the agent responsible for the acute infectious manifestations, neurologic disorders, and immunologic abnormalities linked to the ACQUIRED IMMUNODEFICIENCY SYNDROME.:A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A viral infection caused by the hepatitis C virus.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses.
A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A viral infection caused by the hepatitis C virus.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have known activ
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) related illness, Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled HIV infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have ongoing infection with HIV, hepatitis B (HBsAg positive), or hepatitis C virus (anti-HCV positive)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient known to have active hepatitis B virus (HBV) or hepatitis C virus (HCV) or history of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)?
